choices.label: The figure shows the graph of two curves labeled K and U. The horizontal axis is labeled x. Curve K, concave up, begins at the origin and moves gradually upward and to the right until it intersects curve U approximately three fourths of the way along the x axis and halfway up the vertical axis. At this point, it moves steeply upward and to the right until it ends high above the x axis, far to the right of the vertical axis. Curve U, concave down, begins at the top of the vertical axis and moves gradually downward and to the right until it intersects curve K approximately three fourths of the way along the x axis and halfway up the vertical axis. At this point, it moves steeply downward and to the right until it ends on the x axis, far to the right of the vertical axis.
